intro: Hedyotis palmeri subsp. muzquizana, commonly known as the Muzquizan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Its botanical features include a branched stem and small, elliptical leaves with hairy surfaces. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
